title: Riot Doesnt Care About Outside Game Harassment?
body:
Just tried to report a coward who added me like 10 minutes after the game just to call me names then blocked me as quick as they could but the response I got was "you already reported that person after your recent game with them so we dont accept duplicate reports". This wasnt a duplicate report. This was a report for a separate incident. The person was terrible in the game, yes. But this was a completely separate incident where they added me 10 mins after the game, after I had forgotten who they were, to talk trash and block me asap. So what I am taking from this is riot doesnt give a damn what people say outside of the confines of your match with them. Apparently if you dont like someone you can just add them a bit later and talk all the trash you want and riot wont do anything about it.

..Removed by Moderation..

replies.body:
{{champion:267}} Hey OP,

Ive edited out your addition on your original post. Please remember not to insult others on Boards. If you disagree with others, please do so respectfully and if you feel they have violated any rules, please report their comments to the moderation team.

If you have any questions about this moderation action, don't hesitate to reach out to the Boards Moderation Team via:

* The [**Discuss the Boards**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) sub-board
So you make an edit to insult the board members, when you came here to talk about something and you found it to not be an echo chamber. You're not going to garner much sympathy with that horseshit.
why would you accept a friend request from someone who was toxic to you?

i didnt remember who it was.....I have a lot of friends with smurfs. I didnt check my recently played list. I just accepted the friend request. This was way after the game. I was watching anime for a bit.

You have to opt in to getting flamed by that sort of trash, unlike a game where you cant really do anything about it without blocking people, whic hhas a negative effect on gameplay.

It is not really riot's problem, just dont accept friend requests from trash. If it was exceptionally bad, you can file a support ticket.

I feel like people dont read the full post. I didnt remember the persons name....it was a while after the game. Apparently the person held a grudge. I dont remember every single persons name who I play with. Why is the question "why did you accept the friend request" instead of "why doesnt riot give a damn about outside match harassment?" Regardless of the reason, I accepted the friend request (in this instance I didnt remember who it was) and got bombarded with vitriol for it and riot told me "too bad"

Edit: I DID file a support ticket. Thats what the ENTIRE POST IS ABOUT. I filed a support ticket and got an instant response "this is a duplicate report so it will be disregarded"

If you're adding people as friends who you don't know, that's on you.

It's as if you give your cell phone number to everyone who asks without care, then are surprised when you get marketing texts. It's not your cell phone company to make up for your failure to guard yourself.

Here's the problem:  Unless they're on your recently played list, you can't block them.  See my above post.  I first looked for a "block" button on the guy's profile.  Or a drop-down list where that might be an option.  I couldn't find it.  Riot needs to put that in.  In the OP's case, they had a problem where it had been awhile, so maybe this guy wasn't showing up on that list.  Ergo, he couldn't block the guy.

There's no reason to block them if they send one friend request. Just decline it. If they repeatedly spam you with requests, you can add them then immediately block them from the drop down list.

That being said, maybe after 2-3 requests a "do not show again" for at least 24 hours would be a nice feature.
Well, in my case, the problem was that they DID spam friend requests.

That would be nice. I dont get them often, but the ones who wanna spam requests to add me are obnoxious. My usual at this point to avoid the spam is just leave it unanswered for a day before declining it.
If I get a random friend request, I check my recent game list in client. Easier to remember them by champ they played than name.

Not the same whatsoever. Its like a company broadcasting my number and when I get marketing calls I report them and they go "too bad. you HAVE a phone number". I find most of you peoples' logic extremely flawed.

> [{quoted}](name=KokoroUtsuriYuku,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=RtLeqvgL,comment-id=0001000000010000,timestamp=2019-06-01T01:02:10.795+0000)
>
> Not the same whatsoever. Its like a company broadcasting my number and when I get marketing calls I report them and they go "too bad. you HAVE a phone number". I find most of you peoples' logic extremely flawed.

I don't answer phone calls if I don't know who it is and i don't accept friend requests in game if I don't know who they are.  

Plus you said it happened 10 minutes after your game, then said it was quite a while after your game and that you were watching anime and couldn't remember who you were playing against.  Which one was it?

Seems to me you are looking to argue just for the sake of arguing.  Its not a secret that riot usually wont punish for banter among friends if it doesn't affect other players.

Nobody is broadcasting your name saying "add this guy as a friend and harass them" other than you. You are accepting the friend request - that is the same as you giving out your phone number. If you never accept the request, they cannot harass/insult/offend you.

they dont police it (outside of extreme situations) bc you choose to do it, you clicked "yes i accept even though I dont know this person"

that's on you
Noted. Lemme add you real quick ;)
feel free, i dont make the rules man, get over it
Well, there is your answer, then. Riot cant be bothered to police people opting in to easily avoidable harassment.

You know, funny thing was that I had a little "stalker" like this the other day.  Kept trying to friend me even though I denied him numerous times.  You know what I did?  The last time his friend request came through, I let it sit and played a nice, long game of Summoner's Rift.  Then I accepted his friend request, and sure enough, he had moved on to another game.  BLOCK.  And problem solved.

EDIT: Now that I think about it, I could have just blocked him from the "Recently Played" List, huh? Welp, that's on me.
Yeah, don't accept friend requests from trash. Like the kind of person who would call someone they never encountered trash. Just a bad idea in general.

I'm having trouble imagining them saying "you already reported that person after your recent game with them so we dont accept duplicate reports".
